Ordim
Saturday, October 7th, 2017, 3:22:12 PM

In the tridacna box: Gems [3]: a trio of aquamarine cabochons, several tiny cream-hued pearls, several teardrop emeralds Clothing [2]: a series of thick silver bracelets, a water sapphire-inlaid key

A silver-lined Tridacna box - You get the sense that a silver-lined tridacna box must always have a noun of box. It may never be fashioned into a worn item. It has the following verbs: open and close, but it also has a loresong.

Tugging the hasp from the heart-shaped lock on the rolled lip of the tridacna box, you gently lift the upper piece of the bivalve mollusk to reveal the rich, cobalt blue velvet that lines the bottom half.

You get a sense that the a water sapphire-inlaid key must always have a noun of key, but that the material it is strung from can be changed to anything appropriate for a necklace. It uses the verbs wear, remove, push, pull, and turn. If it is pushed, it will be tucked into your shirt. If it is pulled, it will be removed.

You analyze your thick silver bracelets and sense that the item is largely free from merchant alteration restrictions, but the creator has stated that "The item has restrictions on changing the noun."

The creator has also provided the following information:

The bracelets has special messaging for WEAR, REMOVE, PUSH, and PULL.

The bracelets may be altered, however it must meet the following restrictions: Wrist worn items must keep the noun of bracelet(s), wristlet(s), or bangle(s).

The bracelets may only have a short base description change (see ALTER 2). It cannot support a long or a show description.

The bracelets resonates with your voice, indicating that it enhances its owner in the following ways: It provides a bonus of 5 to Spiritual Lore - Religion Ranks. It provides a bonus of 5 to Armor Use Ranks. This enhancive item may not be used by the following professions: Warrior Rogue Wizard Cleric Empath Sorcerer Ranger Bard Monk Paladin The bracelets looks to have a lot of charges remaining.

You are unable to determine if the thick silver bracelets will persist after its last enhancive charge has been expended.

Nice enhancive for my paladin actually.

I think this may be a T4 from fishing, but they might be worth listing here?

Invoking this off-white vellum will grant you permanent access to a special method of preparing your spells. It will provide the following phrase:

First Person: Your deep heliotrope eyes slip closed and you issue a gentle summons to the spirits of water and moisture asking that they aid you in the casting of [Spell Name]. Their power collects in the air around you and you carefully draw it inward, letting it leave trails upon your ashen skin before sending it outward into the surrounding area. Third Person: Ordim's deep heliotrope eyes slip closed and he issues a gentle summons to the spirits of water and moisture. Flashing around him, the spirits respond and leave trails of their power upon his ashen skin, which he then channels and sends outward into the surrounding area. Hidden or Invisible: Preceding a soft, spoken spell is a gentle summons to the spirits of water and moisture. Specific Spell Restriction: 106

Sunday, October 8th, 2017, 3:06:09 PM

8/200 Longcoat with custom ezscripts.

an ebon suede longcoat with a border of bronze sprockets

This is an EzScripted item. Some alteration restrictions may apply. It has the following messaging:

open 1st Person: You flip a brass toggle at your longcoat's collar, and the bronze sprockets spin as the longcoat opens from neck to hem. 3rd Person:XXX flips a brass toggle at her longcoat's collar, and the bronze sprockets spin as the longcoat opens from neck to hem. Hidden: The subdued whirring of sprockets and clicking of ratchet pawls can be heard from somewhere nearby.

close 1st Person: You flip a brass toggle at your longcoat's collar, and the bronze sprockets spin as the longcoat closes from hem to neck. 3rd Person: XXX flips a brass toggle at her longcoat's collar, and the bronze sprockets spin as the longcoat closes from hem to neck. Hidden: The subdued whirring of sprockets and clicking of ratchet pawls can be heard from somewhere nearby.

pull 1st Person: You tug at your longcoat, settling it more comfortably in place. 3rd Person: XXX tugs at her longcoat, settling it more comfortably in place.

turn 1st Person: You retrieve a small flask from within your longcoat and place a drop of oil here and there among its sprockets, working them back and forth a bit before tucking the flask away. 3rd Person XXX retrieves a small flask from within her longcoat and places a drop of oil here and there among its sprockets, working them back and forth a bit before tucking the flask away.

HJFudge
Sunday, October 8th, 2017, 6:05:03 PM

T5: faenor-banded scalemail

Fashioned of rigid leather and reinforced with indigo faenor plates and bands, this well-used armor bears a small crest of Ta'Ashrim across the chest. Upon closer inspection, it is apparent that the metal parts of the armor have all been scuffed and dyed to a matte finish, while the leather is a rich dark brown. You see nothing unusual, except for a small enchanter's glyph. The hardened armor is adorned with an elegant set of burnished leather pauldrons. The left pauldron has a crest on it, but it is difficult to discern its details from this angle. The right pauldron is expertly tooled with a stylized image of a fierce eel ready to strike.

You analyze your faenor-banded scalemail and sense that the item is largely free from merchant alteration restrictions. The creator has also provided the following information:

You sense that the scalemail can be altered, but bear in mind that no matter what the merchant does, the pauldrons and hardened look of the armor cannot be removed.

This armor has a customized creature on the right pauldron. Some merchants may be able to change the images on your pauldrons, though the options are quite limited.

You can try to RUB, POKE, SLAP, KNOCK, and WEAR the scalemail.

You can tell that the scalemail is as light as it can get.

rub scale You brush the accumulated dust and grime off the pauldrons of your hardened armor, the eel gleaming regally on the right pauldron.

poke scale You rap a finger hard against the hardened armor breastplate!

slap scale You slap lightly at the right pauldron of your hardened armor.

knock scale You thump the hardened breastplate of your armor, glaring around at your surroundings. Your careful inspection of some rigid faenor-banded scalemail allows you to conclude that it is rigid leather armor that covers the torso, arms, legs, neck, and head.

Hips
Tuesday, October 10th, 2017, 2:25:52 PM

There is no monster bold. It'll be a fancy trunk (not dented, damaged, rusted, marred, etc) that looks similar to the ones Kragduk posted above. When you open the trunk/crate/box/chest/whatever, it'll say:

You open the lid on your black willow chest, locking the hinges in place to prop the lid up safely. (T5) OR You open the lid on your black walnut crate, which begins to glow. (T6)

It's pretty neat and apparently historical, but we all know no one hurls weapons that aren't auto-returners. Kind of a waste to have +10 Thrown bonus on the javelin. No one would risk losing it.

a long ironwood case Hinged with bronze, the ironwood case bears the telltale signs of water damage and exposure to cold weather. Splinters stand out from the lid, and one of the four corners is missing its metal footing. The seal of some barony, burned into the side at some point in the piece's past, is illegible due to the ragged scratches that crisscross it.

In the ironwood case you see

  • a horned and demon-faced warmask

  • list itemvultite modwir-hafted javelin

WARMASK - protects like a helmet, +5 Brawling Bonus, +5 Thrown Bonus - Only usable by warriors, rogues, rangers, and paladins

Molded leather covers the demonic face of the warmask, which is comprised of an elongated snout that is drawn back in a sneer and fitted with yellow ivory tusks. Twisted horns rise out of the top, their curved ends ending in points that are capped with steel. An oiled finish gives the piece a weather friendly finish and enhances the incarnadine hue, while a short missive is stamped into the edge.

There appears to be something written on it. In the Common language, it reads: To have died on the wall is to have lived on the wall. ~ Demonwall, 5098

JAVELIN - 4lbs, 4x, ice flares, +10 Thrown Bonus - Only usable by warriors, rogues, rangers, and paladins

Painted incarnadine, the modwir haft of the javelin has a tracery of ebon whorls decorating its smooth surface. Midway down the length is a grip of undyed rawhide that is wrapped in a crosshatch pattern that doubles back on itself for the span of two hands. Vultite rivets hold the matching spear head in place at one end, while the other is capped with black lacquer. ```

Kaight
Wednesday, October 11th, 2017, 10:26:21 AM

T6 Armor [1]: a sea serpent adamantine greatshield Gems [1]: an uncut diamond Special [1]: some silver coins Total items: 3 Large and rectangular, the greatshield is comprised of a single, thick sheet of adamantine that is wrought in the image of a snarling sea serpent. Webbed ears flank its face, while teardrop scales cover most of the breath and girth of its body. Enormous emeralds rest within the eyes, which are covered by long, shaggy brows. The sinuous body is coiled as if rising out of the cresting waves that decorate the bottom of the piece. On the reverse of the greatshield, a complex webbing of oiled leather straps and polished buckles forms an intricate arm harness. The straps are arranged in a pattern that appears able to secure a weapon within. You unbuckle the oiled leather harness of your greatshield. Carefully, you slide your no-dachi into the webbing, then cinch it tightly. You analyze your adamantine greatshield and sense that the item is largely free from merchant alteration restrictions.

The creator has also provided the following information: You get a strong sense that the greatshield can be altered by any merchant as long as the harness" remains in place.

Currently you are able to use DROP, RUB (Get Weapon), TURN, COWER, and PUNCH/KILL/SLAP/BATTER on the adamantine greatshield. The size of the weapon that can be stored in the greatshield's harness is dependent on the size of the shield.

You might be able to have a talented merchant lighten the adamantine greatshield for you.

Kaight
Wednesday, October 11th, 2017, 10:29:00 AM

T5 Containers [1]: a painted brass and oak case Special [1]: some silver coins Total items: 2

get case You grab a painted brass and oak case from inside the bone trunk. examine case Whitewashed and veneered, the oak of the case is uniformly smooth and has a lustrous, mirror-like finish that is accented by the brass closure toggles and hinges. Twin octopuses, wrought of bronze that has an artful verdigris finish, perch upon the rectangular handles, their tentacles inventively wrapping about the long handles and disappearing into the wood.

examine plat Whitewashed and veneered, the oak of the platter is uniformly smooth and has a lustrous, mirror-like finish that is accented by the brass closure toggles and hinges. Twin octopuses, wrought of bronze that has an artful verdigris finish, perch upon the rectangular handles, their tentacles inventively wrapping about the long handles and disappearing into the wood.

examine plate Fashioned with an artfully rolled lip, the broad expanse of the rectangular plate is mostly white with a sateen finish. Indigo blue pigments painted from the top right of the plate create the image of an octopus with twisting tentacles that stretch away from the bulbous head towards the left edge. Delicate brush strokes form the suction cups that decorate the spindled limbs, while prominent ones outline with great detail the cephalopod's eye.

examine tea Uniformly white, the lip of the teacup is smooth and gently rolled to create an even finish. Painted upon one side, an indigo blue octopus stretches its tentacles outward, which the crafter has brilliantly turned into a handle that is complete with three dimensional suction cups.

examine sauc Cobalt blue scallop shells ring the edge of the white, round saucer, the paint startlingly bright against the stark white porcelain. Tiny waves ripple from the edges towards the center, the delicate brushstrokes that are their design frothing at the center where they are drawn in collision with one another.

examine spoon Fashioned of pewter, the spoon is wrought in the image of an octopus perched upon a piece of driftwood. Its long tentacles are wrapped completely around the wood, though the ends manage to clutch onto a shell, which is actually the bowl of the spoon.

Kaight
Wednesday, October 11th, 2017, 10:30:48 AM

T6 Gems [1]: a blackened feystone core Special [1]: an ornate square alum lantern Total items: 2 get lant You grab an ornate square alum lantern from inside the gold trunk.

Fitted with a large metallic ring at its peak, the alum lantern is ornately designed with small filigree designs in the form of autumn leaves, snowflakes, wildflowers, and sheathes of wheat. Three of the lanterns four panels are completely darkened, while the fourth is fashioned of clear glass. A tiny cage beneath the lantern houses metallic screens that have that have oddly punched holes in them, and a short missive is etched across the glass.

read lant In the Common language, it reads: Summer ~ Fall ~ Winter ~ Spring

Beneath the lantern is a tiny cage that houses several screens. Tiny etchings at the bottom of each piece label them and read: Screen 1- The First (Lumnae 16 - 30), Screen 2- The Crystal (Koaratos 1 - 14), Screen 3- The Huntress (i.e., Krrska) (Koaratos 15 - 29), Screen 4- The Guardian (Koaratos 30 - Phoenatos 13), Screen 5- The Sun God (Phoenatos 14 - Phoenatos 27), Screen 6- The Wagon (Phoenatos 28 - Imaerasata 11), Screen 7- The Queen of Enlightenment (Imaerasta 12 - 25), Screen 8- The Trident (Imaerasta 26 - Jastatos 10), Screen 9- The Jackal (Jastatos 11 - 25), Screen 10- The Gryphon (Jastatos 26 - Eoanatos 8), Screen 11- The Lady of the Green (Eoanatos 9 - 23), Screen 12- The Bat (Eoanatos 24 - Eorgaen 4), Screen 13- The Paladin (Eorgaen 8th to the 22nd), Screen 14- The Gates (Eorgaen 23rd to Lormesta 6th), Screen 15- The Grandfather's Eye (Lormesta 7th to Lormesta 20th), Screen 16- The Ur-Daemon (Lormeta 21st to Fashanos 4th), Screen 17- Arachne (Fashanos 5th to the 18th), Screen 18- The Unicorn (Fashanos 19th to Charlatos 5th), Screen 19- The Spire ( Charlatos 6th to Charlatos 20th), Screen 20- The Handmaidens (Charlatos 21 - Olaesta 3), Screen 21- The Hammer (Olaesta 4 - Olaesta 18), Screen 22- The Cat's Paw (Olaesta 19 - Ivastaen 2), Screen 23- The Mistress of Adoration (Ivastaen 3 - 17), Screen 24- The Rat (Ivastaen 18 - Lumnae 1), and Screen 25- The Dragonfly (Lumnae 2 - Lumnae 15). Clearly, the different constellations can be displayed by changing screens. You can accomplish this by turning the lantern and specifying the number of the desired screen. Usage: TURN [MY] lantern (makes it flicker) TURN [MY] lantern TO SCREEN {num} (sets the lantern to use the {num} screen) TURN [MY] lantern TO SCREEN 0 (removes the screen that may already be in place)

You lift your square alum lantern into the air and are rewarded with the silhouette of a constellation upon the floor. Twenty-one stars form the scaly outline of a drake, while a purple hue encompasses the head to complete the silhouette of the constellation.

open my case You unlatch the toggle on your silver and teak case and hear a strange whirring sound, causing you to remove your hand from the toggle. Within seconds, a tiny opening appears at the top of the case and the thin doors are drawn away from each other. The doors at the hinges bend and slide into a small compartment at the bottom, turning the case into a sand and blue lacquered platter. look platt Coarse sand spreads across the interior of the blue lacquered platter to create a beach scene along one side, which slowly transitions to a lacquered blue finish that resembles waves. Starfish decorate the waterline, while bright orange fish are viewed within the lustrous blue side. Cobalt blue porcelain beads, roughly the size of a human's hand, wraps the silver handles. anal platt You analyze your blue lacquered platter and sense that the item is largely free from merchant alteration restrictions.

The creator has also provided the following information:

This blue lacquered platter is a platter that can hold the items necessary for a tea service.

You can have both the case and the platter altered with either a showy description or a long description, but either both must be long descriptions or both must be show descriptions.

You cannot lighten or deepen blue lacquered platter.

Also!

On the blue lacquered platter you see plates, bowls, teacups, saucers, spoons, forks, knives.

look plate Cobalt blue paints stand out brightly upon the smooth face of the porcelain plate, the delicate brushstrokes creating the image of a three-masted frigate in the center. Wavy lines of the same hue provide a subtle border along the lip, while around the vessel's masts puffy clouds pass by and are limned with silver. look teac Cobalt blue paints decorate the bottom of the delicate teacup and depict calm waters under a cloudless sky. Seagulls dip and whirl in the air, while swordfish arc out of the water in wide dives. A filigreed handle, also of porcelain, curves from the side and has a tiny flourish near the base.

Long, straggling strands of hair stick out from all directions, be it head, cheek, or chin, and a pair of pursed lips creates a thin line in the center of the piece. On the reverse of the buckler, a complex webbing of oiled leather straps and polished buckles forms an intricate arm harness. The straps are arranged in a pattern that appears able to secure a weapon within.

2x, lightning flares It provides a bonus of 5 to Dodging Ranks. It provides a bonus of 5 to Agility. The buckler looks to have a lot of charges remaining.

Erous
Sunday, October 15th, 2017, 1:05:10 PM

There's also no secondary market in plat. Items typically stay where they are and in order to build up a solid stash, or quality personal items you need to: 1) Get lucky in the game world hopper or 2) wait for events like EG to come around and win items/raffles/etc.

Prime has the secondary market where power can come at a cost. Power in plat comes from history and luck.

HJFudge
Sunday, October 15th, 2017, 1:07:05 PM

T5: a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls The creator has also provided the following information: A pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls cannot be detailed to indicate that it is anything but long. It cannot be altered to indicate that the lower portion of the garment (below the knees) is tight-fitting in any way; the upper portion can be, but not the lower.

The a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls can be customized in the following manner, where any talented merchant can customize the bolded sections. Note that customizations cannot use speech: (STAND) Standing primly you fluff the fabric of your gown out until it drapes down in a perfectly smooth and unblemished fashion.

(PUSH) You push your hands down against your gown in an elegant gesture.

(PULL) You pull the lower portion of a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls up slightly, displaying your legs. With a great deal of gumption, you move your feet in an intricate dance that leaves you breathless. As you finish, your fingers release the gown's fabric.

(CURTSY) You dip your body, pulling the lower portion of a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls out to either side of you so that the fabric drapes down like a gentle mist around your feet. As you complete the formal curtsy you rise to your feet.

(SMELL) Holding a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls up to your face, you inhale deeply, and the scent of *nightshade and roses fills your senses.

(KNEEL) You pull the hem of your gown up and back, then kneel in a reverent manner.

(WAVE) You grasp the fabric of the skirted portion of a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls and take a single step toward Durakar. Smiling brilliantly you wave your free hand at [target]. (WAVE - sitting) Smiling brilliantly at [target], you immediately rise to your feet, careful not to step on the hem of your gown in your quick movements. You then grasp the fabric of the skirted portion of a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls and wave your free hand at [target]. (standing and sitting utilize the same customization wording)

(TAP - worn) You lightly flick your fingernails against the fabric of gown in a gesture that unequivocally expresses your disinterest. (TAP - not worn) You trace your fingers along a pale silver sea silk gown buttoned down the back with black pearls in a manner that indicates your current disinterest. (worn and not worn utilize the same customization wording)

(NUDGE) As you fiddle with your gown, an amused expression crosses your features.

Currently, you are able to use STAND, RUB, PUSH, TURN, SIT, PULL, CURTSY, SMELL, KNEEL, LIE, WEARMSG, REMOVEMSG, WAVE (with target), COVER, SCOWL, POUT, HUG, TAP, TILT, PLUCK, ROLL (with target), and NUDGE.

T5: knitting needles, auction quality In the knitted pouch: Special [1]: a pair of silver knitting needles Misc [8]: a skein of ebon yarn (5), a skein of aubergine yarn (3) The creator has also provided the following information: These are knitting needles that you can knit yarn with. These are auction-quality needles that can make any pattern. They may be freely altered as long as they remain knitting needles. They can have a long description, but not a show description.

Usage: TURN - Toggle between patterns PROD - Toggle between styles PUSH - Add yarn to the needles DIP - Knit a row PULL - Remove a row or remove yarn from needles SHAKE - Give up on the knitting project

Kithus
Saturday, October 21st, 2017, 8:19:36 AM

T5:
a long ironwood case: Hinged with bronze, the ironwood case bears the telltale signs of water damage and exposure to cold weather. Splinters stand out from the lid and one of the four corners is missing its metal footing. The seal of some barony wood burned into the side at some point in the piece's past is illegible due to the ragged scratches that crisscross it.

In the ironwood case: Weapons [1]: a sculpted white ora greataxe Clothing [1]: a white-maned ironwood warmask

a white-maned ironwood warmask: Polished smooth and preserved with a thin veneer of lacquer, the warmask is artfully carved into the semblance of a severe, bony-faced woman. Aristocratic brows and nose stand out sharply upon the piece, while silver and white horse hairs create a wild mane that spills from the crown and is riddled with tiny bird bones and white dove feathers. Thin lips are pursed in a frozen expression of disdain that is reflected in the cast of the onyx-lined eyes. There appears to be something written on it.

In the Common language, it reads: Ilburz lutkra ap burzmorad - Only when the last feather is plucked will the White Sparrows truly be dead.

The warmask resonates with your voice, indicating that it enhances its owner in the following ways: It provides a bonus of 5 to Swimming Bonus. It provides a bonus of 5 to Two-Handed Weapons Bonus. It provides a bonus of 5 to Survival Bonus. The warmask looks to have a lot of charges remaining.

a sculpted white ora greataxe: Bright white furs encircle the entire length of the ironwood greataxe's haft and are bound in place by undyed rawhide strips. Twin blades, wrought in the image of a bird's wings, rise from the central post in enormous crescents that are softly rounded at the top but sharply pointed at the bottom. A central cap, wrought in the image of a woman's body that is dressed in embossed leathers, completes the piece and is studded with rolaren screws. You see nothing unusual, except for a small enchanter's glyph.

4x, sancted, cold flares

Loresong: Cold grips you as your song touches upon the greataxe, and the world around you dissolves into a barren landscape of snow and ice. You find yourself walking and after a time realize that you are climbing towards a dark shadow in the white distance. Slowly, the dark blur grows closer and reveals itself to be that of a small cottage, where a woman stands with her arm draped protectively over a thin child dressed in furs. You drop to your knees before the scrawny child, who looks impossibly small and frail.

The woman cries out in denial, but quickly stuffs her fist into her mouth to muffle the sound. Your gaze moves uncaring past the woman who now has tears trailing down her cheeks, and instead focuses upon the fire-haired child. With great care, you place the greataxe into her incredibly small hands and once more, the older woman cries out in denial. The roar follows you back to your body and sets your ears to ringing as the vision fades. You lift your voice to the greataxe, and you find your vision return to the cold, bleak peak only to instantly be assaulted by the previous cries of denial. Stoically, you ignore the source and begin to speak to the young girl in a voice worn with age.

"His final words for you, little one," you find yourself saying, "--were to find the Sparrows and join the flock." This time, the savage cry of rage slams into you, and your vision swims.

Despite the assault, the greataxe fills your sight with image after image of the young girl growing older. One scene repeats itself over and over, that of the child doing push-ups in her room with the axe strapped to her back. The passage of time is noted by her hair growing longer, her body becoming lithe, and her muscles gaining bulk. The vision begins to fade as the child-turned-woman stands, greataxe on her back, in a defiant pose before a heartbroken older woman. A different song and scene greets you as you sing to the greataxe, and gone is the snow, ice, and silence of the mountains. Instead, a bustling port sprawls before you, but even in the throng of people, you can easily make out the now tall, flame-haired girl. She strides purposefully to a ship that has strangely dressed men and women moving about it, their faces painted white and their bodies draped in blue fur. A look of recognition and yearning fills the young woman's eyes.

Scene after scene begins to rapidly play before you. Each is filled with the flame-haired young woman diving into battle after battle upon the decks of a large ship. The thrumming pulse of countless battles shows ferocity and determination -- her strengths and her finesse. At times, she is the shield to the comrade that has fallen, while at others, she is the rage that charges headlong into the fray; always the greataxe in her hands. Slowly, your vision fades in a sea of blue furs. Coldness grips you, and your vision shifts to the deck of a ship littered with bodies and locked in ice. The vessel is unmoving, and the mast is wreathed in long icicles that pierce the blood-blackened boards. Easily identifiable amid the fur-wrapped bodies, the young woman can be seen crouching upon the deck, her red hair trailing behind her in a persistent wind that has turned her lips blue. Slowly, she lowers her beloved greataxe into a case and, begins to pray.

"Charl, I beseech you," she prays in a surprisingly gentle voice. "Break free your children, and return us to port. In return, I will give you the very soul of my existence."

With a great cry, she uses the last of her strength to hurl the greataxe off of the ship. The cry of anguish that is drawn from her body is reminiscent of the one her mother made many years ago, but it is eclipsed by the sound of the ice creaking and the ship slipping free. The vision slowly fades away. Cold grips you, but no vision floods to your mind's eye. Instead, you hear the sound of battle, the crash of waves, and a defiant woman's voice challenging all to disobey her.
